item.title: Android Pen-testing Environment Setup on M1 Mac
item.description: If you have got yourself a Mac to get better at hacking (of course ethically), then you might have already tried setting up an android penetration testing environment in your laptop. Definitely, I agree that this is a tough nut to crack. You might have faced several issues, whether it’s about installing Genymotion or about SSL Pinning bypass. Don’t worry we will cover all the steps to create a setup from scratch.

About Hello ðŸ‘‹ Iâ€™m Mahesh Jandwani. I live in Abu Road, Rajasthan. Iâ€™m a security engineer at ACKO, working on cloud and product security. Iâ€™ve done my studies in Computer Science and Engineering at the JECRC University of Jaipur, Rajasthan. Previously, Iâ€™ve worked as a Penetration Tester intern at ThreatHawk and as a Cloud Security Associate at Virtually Testing Foundation. Contact You can reach me by email at maheshjhandwani9999@gmail.com. You can also connect with me on LinkedIn, GitHub, and Twitter.
